# ctrl-http-server

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/martin-experiments/ctrl-http-server.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/martin-experiments/ctrl-http-server)
[![Codacy Badge](https://api.codacy.com/project/badge/Grade/de53d9ef604a4c03a498e821f3ec2cdb)](https://www.codacy.com/app/suitupalex/ctrl-http-server?utm_source=github.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=martin-experiments/ctrl-http-server&utm_campaign=Badge_Grade)
[![Codacy Badge](https://api.codacy.com/project/badge/Coverage/de53d9ef604a4c03a498e821f3ec2cdb)](https://www.codacy.com/app/suitupalex/ctrl-http-server?utm_source=github.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=martin-experiments/ctrl-http-server&utm_campaign=Badge_Coverage)

An abstraction around hapi.js.

## Installation

[Yarn](https://yarnpkg.com) is recommended for installation.

```bash
$ yarn add ctrl-http-server
```

But you can still use npm:

```bash
$ npm install --save ctrl-http-server
```

## Usage

```javascript
// Example app.js:

const CtrlHttpServer = require('ctrl-http-server')

const ctrlHttpServer = new CtrlHttpServer({port: 8080})

ctrlHttpServer.get('/route', (request, reply) => {
  reply('Hello, world!')
})

ctrlHttpServer.start()
```
